com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler

Interface TaskKiller

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultTaskKiller

    public interface TaskKiller
    This interface should be implemented to allow components to request the killing of Mesos Tasks. This is a normal part of restarting a Task, which is a normal part of updating the Configuration of a Task. This is also useful for allowing end-users to mitigate problems with Tasks when they manually determine that a Task should be restarted or permanently replaced.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void killTask(TaskID taskId, RecoveryType recoveryType)
      This method should accept Tasks which the caller wishes to kill.
      TaskKiller setSchedulerDriver(SchedulerDriver driver)
      Configures this instance with the SchedulerDriver to be invoked when killing tasks.

    • Method Detail

      • setSchedulerDriver

        TaskKiller setSchedulerDriver(SchedulerDriver driver)
        Configures this instance with the SchedulerDriver to be invoked when killing tasks. This must be called at least once before killTask(TaskID, RecoveryType) is invoked.
        Returns:
        this

      • killTask

        void killTask(TaskID taskId,
              RecoveryType recoveryType)
        This method should accept Tasks which the caller wishes to kill. The kill may be destructive (for restarting at a new location) or it may be killed with the intention of later being restarted (for in-place restart). This method does not synchronously kill the Task. Mesos will periodically provide a SchedulerDriver which may be used to process requested Task kills.
        Parameters:
        taskId - ID of the task to be restarted
        recoveryType - A flag indicating the type of kill to perform, TRANSIENT or PERMANENT
